list.name: According to the Bible, "faith is the substance of things hoped for, the ____ of things not seen."
Jesus said the ones who are blessed are those who have not ____ but yet believe.
Faith is to assent to all the truths that God has ____ though it is not ____ to do this.
Faith is to ____ oneself totally to God, which is why it is about a ____ with God,
The word ____ means “Yes, it is true.”
Faith is not merely personal, but ecclesial. It is the ____ that believes.
Faith is a free ____ offered to everyone, but it must be received and “opened.”
Faith is a fully ____ because it involves the intellect and the will of a person.
Faith is NOT a ____ leap (rather a “step” which-we have reasons to take).
Faith is NOT ____ to reason, but builds upon and perfects reason.
Faith is not simply subjective, but includes objective and ____ claims about reality.
Faith and science answer different ____; they are not opposed to but mutually ____ one another.
Faith is dynamic — it always grows and ____.
Faith is a ____ virtue.
The ACT OF FAITH states that we believe all that God has revealed because God is ____ itself and cannot ____ nor be ____.
Theology is the ____ of faith, according to St. Thomas Aquinas.
Theology deduces unknown truths from ____ ones and certain principles by means of correct conclusions.
The theologian receives and believingly embraces the infallible truths of Divine ____.
The theologian erects the foundation of these infallible truths a logical body of ____, by means of logical construction, systematic grouping, and correct deductions.

The theologian receives and believingly embraces the infallible truths of Divine ____.

Theology is a reflective and scientific ____ of the understanding of God’s Word in light of faith, according to St. John Paul Ill.
Theology is faith seeking ____
Theology is first among the sciences; it is called the ____ of the sciences.

Two reasons that theology is first among the sciences are because of the ____ it ensures being based in truth directly revealed by God, and — it guides human beings beyond merely this world to his ____ end.
God reveals Himself to us because He desires a ____ with us.
Divine Revelation is passed down to us through ____
The Word of God (Divine Revelation) passed on orally is called Sacred ____
The Word of God (Divine Revelation) passed on in writing is called Sacred ____
The official teaching of the Church is made up of the ____ and the ____ , the successors of Peter and the Apostles.

The task of authentically interpreting the Word of God whether passed on orally or in writing belongs exclusively to the ____ which is guided to all truth by the Holy Spirit. It is responsible for safeguarding and preserving the sacred deposit of ____.
We can know some things about God by reason alone, like that He ____ but this knowledge is not enough have a relationship with Him. This is why God needs to ____ Himself to us.
We believe that the Holy Spirit ____ the Sacred Scriptures.
